cont.entity_a: The product description did not match the actual item, missing a strap, incorrect camera model, and missing settings indicator and side cover.
The camera works, but there are some missing parts.
cont.entity_b: The lens has spots that appear in photos, suggesting internal lens issues.

cont.entity_a: The manual is available online at Canon and the editing software is free for Windows 10.
The camera takes clear pictures and is compatible with older Canon lenses. The camera's picture quality is excellent.
cont.entity_b: Low noise performance is above average at ISO1600.

Usability.comm: The camera is easy to use.

cont.entity_a: The camera is suitable for beginners. The camera has an automatic mode for easy use.
cont.entity_b: Allowing focus on photography rather than settings.

cont.entity_a: The camera's battery life is excellent. The camera's battery drains quickly.
cont.entity_b: The battery lasts long. The camera's battery issues include one battery dying quickly and a broken cord port.

cont.entity_a: The camera has been reliable over several years.
cont.entity_b: The camera is dependable, lasting through extensive use.

Compatibility.comm: The camera is compatible with older Canon lenses.

cont.entity_a: The camera is lightweight and easy to carry.
The camera has a quick startup and can take multiple pictures per second.

cont.entity_b: The autofocus is fast and accurate.

cont.entity_a: The camera's build quality is questioned.
cont.entity_b: The camera is solid and sturdy.

cont.entity_a: The camera's lens is standard, with telescopic lenses costing more.
cont.entity_b: The lens bundled with the camera is adequate, but a 17-85mm EFS IS lens is recommended for flexibility.

cont.entity_a: The camera's auto pop-up flash is a bit challenging to use.
cont.entity_b: The flash sometimes fails to pop up, but cleaning resolves this. The camera's built-in flash works well once understood.

cont.entity_a: The camera's pictures are not good in low light without a flash. The camera's image stabilization is lacking for night shots.
The camera's controls are not intuitive. The camera's manual adjustments are non-intuitive.
cont.entity_b: The on/off switch is awkwardly placed.

cont.entity_a: The camera's older model uses compact flash instead of an SD card.
cont.entity_b: The camera's file naming system does not allow prefix customization, risking overwriting pictures.
The camera does not take video.
The camera's algorithms are advanced and it is worth the price.
The camera's shutter speed is impressive.
The camera has a rapid shooting feature.
The camera is almost 10 years old.
The camera lacks true spot metering and has a loud mirror slap.
The camera's battery compartment door is flimsy.
